verses.verse: It happened in those days, <S%H3117><s%> when there was no king <S%H4428><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> that there was a certain <S%H376><s%> Levite <S%H3881><s%> living <S%H1481><s%> on the farther side <S%H3411><s%> of the hill <S%H2022><s%> country of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> who took <S%H3947><s%> to him a concubine <S%H802><s%> out of Bethlehem Judah. <S%H1035><s%>

His concubine <S%H6370><s%> played the prostitute <S%H2181><s%> against him, <S%H3212><s%> and went away from him to her father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> to Bethlehem Judah, <S%H1035><s%> and was there the space of four <S%H702><s%> months. <S%H2320><s%>

Her husband <S%H376><s%> arose, <S%H6965><s%> and went <S%H3212><s%> after <S%H310><s%> her, <S%H1696><s%> to speak kindly <S%H3820><s%> to her, <S%H7725><s%> to bring her again, having his servant <S%H5288><s%> with him, <S%H6776><s%> and a couple of donkeys: <S%H2543><s%> and she brought <S%H935><s%> him into her father <S%H1><s%>'s house; <S%H1004><s%> and when the father <S%H1><s%> of the young lady <S%H5291><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> him, <S%H8055><s%> he rejoiced to meet him. <S%H7125><s%>

His father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, the young lady <S%H5291><s%>'s father, <S%H1><s%> retained <S%H2388><s%> him; <S%H3427><s%> and he stayed with him three <S%H7969><s%> days: <S%H3117><s%> so they ate <S%H398><s%> and drink, <S%H8354><s%> and lodged there. <S%H3885><s%>

It happened on the fourth <S%H7243><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> that they arose early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and he rose up <S%H6965><s%> to depart: <S%H3212><s%> and the young lady <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his son-in <S%H2860><s%>-law, "Strengthen <S%H5582><s%> your heart <S%H3820><s%> with a morsel <S%H6595><s%> of bread, <S%H3899><s%> and afterward <S%H310><s%> you shall go your way. <S%H3212><s%>"

So they sat down, <S%H3427><s%> ate, <S%H398><s%> and drank, <S%H8354><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them together: <S%H3162><s%> and the young lady <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the man, <S%H376><s%> "Please be pleased <S%H2974><s%> to stay all night, <S%H3885><s%> and let your heart <S%H3820><s%> be merry. <S%H3190><s%>"
The man <S%H376><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> to depart; <S%H3212><s%> but his father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law urged <S%H6484><s%> him, <S%H3885><s%> and he lodged there again. <S%H7725><s%>

He arose early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> on the fifth <S%H2549><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> to depart; <S%H3212><s%> and the young lady <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Please strengthen <S%H5582><s%> your heart <S%H3824><s%> and stay <S%H4102><s%> until the day declines; <S%H3117><s%>" and they both <S%H8147><s%> ate. <S%H398><s%>

When the man <S%H376><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> to depart, <S%H3212><s%> he, <S%H6370><s%> and his concubine, and his servant, <S%H5288><s%> his father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, the young lady <S%H5291><s%>'s father, <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H3117><s%> "Behold, now the day draws <S%H7503><s%> toward evening, <S%H6150><s%> please stay all night: <S%H3885><s%> behold, <S%H3117><s%> the day grows to an end, <S%H2583><s%> lodge <S%H3885><s%> here, <S%H3824><s%> that your heart may be merry; <S%H3190><s%> and tomorrow <S%H4279><s%> go on your way <S%H1870><s%> early, <S%H7925><s%> that you may go <S%H1980><s%> home. <S%H168><s%>"

But the man <S%H376><s%> wouldn't <S%H14><s%> stay that night, <S%H3885><s%> but he rose up <S%H6965><s%> and departed, <S%H3212><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> over against <S%H5227><s%> Jebus <S%H2982><s%> (the same is Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>): and there were with him a couple <S%H6776><s%> of donkeys <S%H2543><s%> saddled; <S%H2280><s%> his concubine also was with him. <S%H6370><s%>

When they were by Jebus, <S%H2982><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> was far <S%H3966><s%> spent; <S%H7286><s%> and the servant <S%H5288><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his master, <S%H113><s%> "Please come <S%H3212><s%> and let us turn aside <S%H5493><s%> into this city <S%H5892><s%> of the Jebusites, <S%H2983><s%> and lodge in it. <S%H3885><s%>"

His master <S%H113><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H5493><s%> "We won't turn aside into the city <S%H5892><s%> of a foreigner, <S%H5237><s%> that is not of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel; <S%H3478><s%> but we will pass over <S%H5674><s%> to Gibeah. <S%H1390><s%>"

He said <S%H559><s%> to his servant, <S%H5288><s%> "Come <S%H3212><s%> and let us draw near <S%H7126><s%> to one <S%H259><s%> of these places; <S%H4725><s%> and we will lodge <S%H3885><s%> in Gibeah, <S%H1390><s%> or in Ramah. <S%H7414><s%>"

So they passed on <S%H5674><s%> and went their way; <S%H3212><s%> and the sun <S%H8121><s%> went down <S%H935><s%> on them near <S%H681><s%> to Gibeah, <S%H1390><s%> which belongs to Benjamin. <S%H1144><s%>

They turned aside <S%H5493><s%> there, <S%H935><s%> to go in to lodge <S%H3885><s%> in Gibeah: <S%H1390><s%> and he went in, <S%H935><s%> and sat him down <S%H3427><s%> in the street <S%H7339><s%> of the city; <S%H5892><s%> for there was no man <S%H376><s%> who took <S%H622><s%> them into his house <S%H1004><s%> to lodge. <S%H3885><s%>

Behold, <S%H935><s%> there came an old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> from his work <S%H4639><s%> out of the field <S%H7704><s%> at evening: <S%H6153><s%> now the man was <S%H376><s%> of the hill <S%H2022><s%> country of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> and he lived <S%H1481><s%> in Gibeah; <S%H1390><s%> but the men <S%H582><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> were Benjamites. <S%H1145><s%>

He lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> the wayfaring <S%H732><s%> man <S%H376><s%> in the street <S%H7339><s%> of the city; <S%H5892><s%> and the old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Where are you going? <S%H3212><s%> Where <S%H370><s%> did you come from? <S%H935><s%>"

He said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H5674><s%> "We are passing from Bethlehem Judah <S%H1035><s%> to the farther side <S%H3411><s%> of the hill <S%H2022><s%> country of Ephraim. <S%H669><s%> I am from there, <S%H3212><s%> and I went to Bethlehem Judah. <S%H1035><s%> I am going <S%H1980><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Yahweh; <S%H3068><s%> and there is no man <S%H376><s%> who takes <S%H622><s%> me into his house. <S%H1004><s%>

Yet there is <S%H3426><s%> both straw <S%H8401><s%> and provender <S%H4554><s%> for our donkeys; <S%H2543><s%> and there is bread <S%H3899><s%> and wine <S%H3196><s%> also for me, <S%H519><s%> and for your handmaid, and for the young man <S%H5288><s%> who is with your servants: <S%H5650><s%> there is no want <S%H4270><s%> of anything. <S%H1697><s%>"

The old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Peace <S%H7965><s%> be to you; <S%H7535><s%> howsoever let all your wants <S%H4270><s%> lie on me; <S%H3885><s%> only don't lodge in the street. <S%H7339><s%>"

So he brought <S%H935><s%> him into his house, <S%H1004><s%> and gave the donkeys <S%H2543><s%> fodder; <S%H1101><s%> and they washed <S%H7364><s%> their feet, <S%H7272><s%> and ate <S%H398><s%> and drink. <S%H8354><s%>

As they were making their hearts <S%H3820><s%> merry, <S%H3190><s%> behold, <S%H582><s%> the men of the city, <S%H5892><s%> certain <S%H582><s%> base <S%H1100><s%> fellows, <S%H582><s%> surrounded <S%H5437><s%> the <S%H5437><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> beating <S%H1849><s%> at the door; <S%H1817><s%> and they spoke <S%H559><s%> to the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> the old <S%H2205><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Bring out <S%H3318><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> who came <S%H935><s%> into your house, <S%H1004><s%> that we may have sex with him! <S%H3045><s%>"

The man, <S%H376><s%> the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> to them, <S%H559><s%> and said to them, <S%H408><s%> "No, my brothers, <S%H251><s%> please don't <S%H7489><s%> act so wickedly; since <S%H310><s%> this man <S%H376><s%> has come <S%H935><s%> into my house, <S%H1004><s%> don't <S%H6213><s%> do this folly. <S%H5039><s%>

Behold, <S%H1330><s%> here is my virgin daughter <S%H1323><s%> and his concubine. <S%H6370><s%> I will bring them out <S%H3318><s%> now. <S%H6031><s%> Humble them, <S%H6213><s%> and do with them what seems <S%H5869><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> to you; <S%H376><s%> but to this man don't <S%H6213><s%> do any <S%H2063><s%> such <S%H1697><s%> folly. <S%H5039><s%>"

But the men <S%H582><s%> wouldn't <S%H14><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to him: <S%H376><s%> so the man laid <S%H2388><s%> hold of his concubine, <S%H6370><s%> and brought <S%H3318><s%> her out <S%H2351><s%> to them; <S%H3045><s%> and they had sex with her, <S%H5953><s%> and abused her all night <S%H3915><s%> until the morning: <S%H1242><s%> and when the day <S%H7837><s%> began to dawn, <S%H5927><s%> they let her go. <S%H7971><s%>

Then came <S%H935><s%> the woman <S%H802><s%> in the dawning <S%H6437><s%> of the day, <S%H1242><s%> and fell down <S%H5307><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of the man <S%H376><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> where her lord <S%H113><s%> was, <S%H216><s%> until it was light.

Her lord <S%H113><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and opened <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> and went out <S%H3318><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> his way; <S%H1870><s%> and behold, <S%H802><s%> the woman his concubine <S%H6370><s%> was fallen down <S%H5307><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> with her hands <S%H3027><s%> on the threshold. <S%H5592><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H6965><s%> "Get up, and let us be going! <S%H3212><s%>" but no one <S%H376><s%> answered. <S%H6030><s%> Then he <S%H376><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> her up on the donkey; <S%H2543><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> rose up, <S%H6965><s%> and went to his place. <S%H4725><s%>

When he had come <S%H935><s%> into his house, <S%H1004><s%> he took <S%H3947><s%> a knife, <S%H3979><s%> and laid hold <S%H2388><s%> on his concubine, <S%H6370><s%> and divided <S%H5408><s%> her, <S%H6106><s%> limb by limb, into twelve <S%H8147><s%> pieces, <S%H5409><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> her throughout all the borders <S%H1366><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

It was so, <S%H1961><s%> that all who saw <S%H7200><s%> it said, <S%H559><s%> "There was no such deed <S%H2063><s%> done nor seen <S%H7200><s%> from the day <S%H3117><s%> that the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> to this day! <S%H3117><s%> Consider <S%H7760><s%> it, <S%H5779><s%> take counsel, and speak. <S%H1696><s%>"
